document_data.name: Giant Owl
document_data.language: [[Giant Owl language|Giant Owl]], understands [[Common]], [[Elven language|Elvish]] and [[Sylvan]] but can't speak
document_data.mainbody: '''Giant owls''' were magical creatures that appeared to be abnormally large [[owl]]s.{{Cite web enhancement/Deity Do's and Don'ts|10-15}}
document_data.Description: In addition to their great size, ({{SI|9|feet|long=yes}} tall with a wingspan of {{SI|20|feet|long=yes}},) these creatures were intelligent and capable of speech.
document_data.Combat: Giants owls attacked by gliding above their foes and striking at them with their talons. When possible, giant owls would band together to attack in concert.

Ecology.Habitats:
Giant owls could be often encountered by the traders traveling from [[Luskan]] to [[Ten Towns]] of [[Icewind Dale]]. The smaller creatures, those less than {{SI|4|ft}} in height, were in danger of being preyed upon by these nocturnal birds.

In the [[Unapproachable East]], giant owls could be found in the forests of [[Rashemen]].<ref>

document_data.History: ''Circa'' the {{YearlinkName|1374}}, one could find giant owls stabled, bred, sold and used as [[mount]]s by the [[Zhentarim]] within the [[Temple in the Sky]] and other Zhentarim outposts in the [[Spine of the World]].<ref>
document_data.Trivia:
* A number of magic items in the Realms were able to summon giant owls, including the ''[[Bird feather headdress]]'' and a version of the ''[[Great Druid's Staff]]''.
* The spell ''[[conjure animals]]'' could summon a giant owl to the aid of its caster.<ref>
* The spell ''[[flight of Remnis]]'' could summon a giant owl to the aid of its caster.
* A giant owl could be pulled from a ''[[robe of useful items]]''.<ref>
